title: Miner crashes at (Invalid header on mined block) err="block in the future"
body:
#### System information

Geth version: 1.6.0-unstable
OS & Version: Linux
Commit hash : (if `develop`)
9aca9e6deb243b87cc75325be593a3b0c2f0a113

#### Expected behaviour
I have a private network with 2 geth instances connected to it
When I try to start a 3rd instance as a miner using the following:

`geth  --rpcport "8547" --datadir "./datadir/" --port "30305" --networkid 22 --mine --minerthreads=1 --etherbase=0xXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX --bootnodes "enode://XXXXXXX" `

I expect the miner to start mining, and continue to mine and process all transaction


#### Actual behaviour
Currently the miner starts mining 

```
INFO [04-06|13:46:56] Starting mining operation 
INFO [04-06|13:46:56] Commit new mining work                   number=1 txs=0 uncles=0 elapsed=118.478ﾂｵs
INFO [04-06|13:46:56] Successfully sealed new block            number=1 hash=b1a4cd窶ｦefe37e
INFO [04-06|13:46:56] 沐ｨ mined potential block                  number=1 hash=b1a4cd窶ｦefe37e
INFO [04-06|13:46:56] Commit new mining work                   number=2 txs=0 uncles=0 elapsed=183.846ﾂｵs
INFO [04-06|13:46:58] Successfully sealed new block            number=2 hash=a79a43窶ｦ9bd710
INFO [04-06|13:46:58] 沐ｨ mined potential block                  number=2 hash=a79a43窶ｦ9bd710
INFO [04-06|13:46:58] Commit new mining work                   number=3 txs=0 uncles=0 elapsed=144.137ﾂｵs
INFO [04-06|13:46:59] Successfully sealed new block            number=3 hash=20fbe7窶ｦ583ce0
```

then after a 1 or 2 mins it halts and stops processing/mining on my private network with the following error:

```
INFO [04-06|13:47:44] Commit new mining work                   number=37 txs=0 uncles=0 elapsed=109.409ﾂｵs
INFO [04-06|13:47:44] Successfully sealed new block            number=37 hash=a9e8d1窶ｦ64b7cc
ERROR[04-06|13:47:44] Invalid header on mined block            err="block in the future"
```



Am I missing something ? Please help


Same issue is happening when I try to do miner.start() from the console of a geth connected instance

Ah yes, we also hit this today. A huge consensus refactor was merged into Geth yesterday I believe to cater for different consensus engines, and it broke the miner for low difficulty networks. There's a PR https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/13870 to fix it, but it still needs a review confirm to merge. Feel free to run that PR, it should be stable enough (given that you're running master branch anyway) :)
This should be fixed on latest master. Please check and report if you see anything like this. I really appreciate errors around this refactor :)

@karalabe just verified the this! works great!
Thanks :+1:
How many nodes are you running? What's the topology? How fast are blocks mined? What's the current gas limit?

I'm running 3 nodes and 1 bootnode.

here's an output of my miner that am running on one of the nodes:
```

INFO [04-11|17:17:28] 沐 block reached canonical chain          number=5344 hash=ee4046窶ｦd97ca2

INFO [04-11|17:17:32] 沐ｨ mined potential block                  number=5350 hash=b64699窶ｦe149c9
INFO [04-11|17:17:32] Commit new mining work                   number=5351 txs=0 uncles=0 elapsed=131.078ﾂｵs
INFO [04-11|17:17:36] Successfully sealed new block            number=5351 hash=44a845窶ｦf68b9a

INFO [04-11|17:17:36] Commit new mining work                   number=5352 txs=0 uncles=0 elapsed=118.884ﾂｵs

INFO [04-11|17:17:48] 沐 block reached canonical chain          number=5347 hash=f1b8ab窶ｦdd851a
INFO [04-11|17:17:48] 沐ｨ mined potential block                  number=5352 hash=2b483d窶ｦ6acb66
INFO [04-11|17:17:48] Commit new mining work                   number=5353 txs=0 uncles=0 elapsed=143.227ﾂｵs
INFO [04-11|17:17:53] Successfully sealed new block            number=5353 hash=d6c7cc窶ｦc87da5
INFO [04-11|17:17:53] 沐 block reached canonical chain          number=5348 hash=7eddc0窶ｦ302c70
INFO [04-11|17:17:53] 沐ｨ mined potential block                  number=5353 hash=d6c7cc窶ｦc87da5
INFO [04-11|17:17:53] Commit new mining work                   number=5354 txs=0 uncles=0 elapsed=130.011ﾂｵs
INFO [04-11|17:17:54] Successfully sealed new block            number=5354 hash=8161c5窶ｦ533cc6
INFO [04-11|17:17:54] 沐 block reached canonical chain          number=5349 hash=4d6299窶ｦcc3737
INFO [04-11|17:17:54] 沐ｨ mined potential block                  number=5354 hash=8161c5窶ｦ533cc6
INFO [04-11|17:17:54] Commit new mining work                   number=5355 txs=0 uncles=0 elapsed=166.668ﾂｵs
INFO [04-11|17:17:57] Successfully sealed new block            number=5355 hash=357efc窶ｦ9b14d3
INFO [04-11|17:17:57] 沐 block reached canonical chain          number=5350 hash=b64699窶ｦe149c9
INFO [04-11|17:17:57] 沐ｨ mined potential block                  number=5355 hash=357efc窶ｦ9b14d3
INFO [04-11|17:17:57] Commit new mining work                   number=5356 txs=0 uncles=0 elapsed=156.429ﾂｵs

```

Current gas limit is 4712388

Sooo... could you try latest master (it's enough to update the miner)? :D This was a loooong standing bug with networks consisting of a single miner (the miner never considered itself synced, and rejected transactions). A fix for this was merged in 2 days ago I think.
ok I'll try that. I don't need to reset my chain , correct ? I just need to update geth
Yup, updating the miner node is enough.

Good morning all, I have just install 1.6.0 and things seem not to be working as they were. Amoung other issues ( cannot pre-fund ingenesis.json ) I cannot mine either. Geth crashed when I run miner.start(1); Any help?. Hello Karalabe back again :-)

@karalabe fixed! I just used the latest version. Did a git pull, now it's working.

@sarbao I'm using the latest commit in 1.6.0, I can mine, everything works fine. miner.start() doesn't crash. something might be wrong on your config.

Good morning msolina,

  Yes something must be wrong but I am desperatly trying to find out. Could it be the genesis I am using ?. I would like to run like u 3 nodes 1 of them being the miner. But no succeed on the mining. I was able to connect all 3 nodes but when I start the miner nth is happening. I prefund the nodes succesfully but something as you said must be wrong cause I neved mined :-( ... its my 5th day with the issue aggg!. Appreciate if u can guide with this. Bets regards. SAlvador

Make sure you didn't set a too high difficulty, causing you 1 core cpu
mining not to find any solutions in a reasonable time frame

Hi Peter

Pls find enclosed the log file generated in the flow. WHen I run
miner.start(1); it started to generate DAG and after 10% crashed.

This is the step I took:

Step 1: geth --datadir "/tmp/dataDir/1" init
"/srv/tokenizer/genesis2GTH_161_reset.json"
Step 2: geth --datadir "/tmp/dataDir/2" init
"/srv/tokenizer/genesis2GTH_161_reset.json"

Step 3: geth --datadir "/tmp/dataDir/1" --networkid 12345001 --verbosity 3
 --vmodule=ethash=5 --ipcdisable --rpc --port 30301 --rpcport 8545
--rpcaddr localhost console 2>> /tmp/dataDir/nodo1.log
Step 4: geth --datadir "/tmp/dataDir/2" --networkid 12345001 --verbosity 3
 --vmodule=ethash=5 --ipcdisable --rpc --port 30302 --rpcport 8546
--rpcaddr localhost console 2>> /tmp/dataDir/nodo2.log

Step 5: I connect both nodes with admin.addPeer and they got connected
Step 6: I ran personal.newAccount on both
Step 7: I ran miner.start(1) and after a while it chrashed

I enclosed also my genesis

Bets reagrds

Salvador

getting 0 ... still not mining :-(
